column.note: Account ID - used to identify the Account-often comes from CRMs.More typically would be called 'Account ID'. This must be unique within a site.
User Role: PortalUser, PortalAdminUser, SysAdmin, OpsAdmin, ProdMgr, SalesOpMgr, ITBackOfficeMgr, OrderEntry, Executive, or CustSupport.
User's Email Address.

Must be a valid ISO 3166 two letter Country Code. Codes can be found at http://www.iso.org/iso/en/prods-services/iso3166ma/02iso-3166-code-lists/list-en1.html. Common codes are US for United States and CA for Canada.
Deployment State options: - Deployed (default) - Draft - Inactive - Obsolete
Name of the product you are licensing and selling.
The version number (for example, 2 or 2.3) of the product.

Name of the old product you are licensing and selling. This is mandatory if this is an update operation of product name/version. Please note if this field has valid value it will be considered as an update of the product name/version found matching the OldProductName and OldProductVersion, if product is not found with the given OldProductName and OldProductVersion then there will be no update to the product name/version. This field will be ignored in case a product is found with the original product name/version.

The version number (for example, 2 or 2.3) of the old product. This is mandatory in case OldProductName has a value and this is an update operation of product name/version. If this is not specified in case of an update operation and if product is not found with the given OldProductName and OldProductVersion then there will be no update to the product name/version. This field will be ignored in case a product is found with the original product name/version.
The type of product. Options are: - LicensedProduct (default) - Suite - Maintenance
Number of products in the line item. Default is 1.
Product Line to map to this product. Available product lines are:
License technology with which this product works. Available technologies are:
License generator configuration with which this product works. Available generators are:

The License Models linked to this product, a model must be specified prior to deployment. Multiple models are delimited with the | (pipe) character. For example model1|model2|model3. Available model types are:
The default transaction key for the trusted license model. This is a required field when the LicenseModels field contains a trusted license model.
The virtual transaction key or the trusted license model. This is a required field when the LicenseModels field contains a trusted license model.
Detailed description.

Specify the FNP licensing version(s) for cross-version signature support required by your product. This is a comma separated list (for example: 7.1,8.0) with possible values of: - 7.1 - 8.0 - 8.1 - 8.4 - 10.1 - 10.8 - 11.4 - 11.6

Uniquely specify the Package Name, most of the time this is the same as the ProductName. When this field is filled in, PackageVersionFormat is also required to be set, and if PackageVersionFormat=Fixed, PackageVersion is also required to be set. Applies to FlexNet Licensing only.

Specify the Package Version format. Possible values are: - Fixed (default) - Date Based This field is required if PackageName is set. If PackageVersionFormat=Fixed, PackageVersion is also required to be set. Applies to FlexNet Licensing only.
Specify the Package Version number (like 2 or 2.3) that describes this package. This field is required if PackageVersionFormat=Fixed. Applies to FlexNet Licensing only.
If the product can be used on a device set to 'Yes' else set to 'No' (default). Applies to FlexNet Licensing only.
The resource bundle key corresponding to the license header text.
The resource bundle key corresponding to the license trailer text.
Set to 'Yes' to permit the downloading of obsolete fulfillments from the Producer Portal. Set to 'No' (default) to prohibit it.
Set to 'Yes' to permit the downloading of obsolete fulfillments from the End-User Portal. Set to 'No' (default) to prohibit it.
A Feature is a capability that you want to license in a Product.
The version number of this Feature. The FeatureVersion is only required when the VersionFormat is set to Fixed.
License model to use. Available license models are:
The product part number mapped to this entitlement.
The identifier that uniquely identifies the entitlement.
State of the entitlement. Choices are: - Deployed (default) - Draft - Obsolete - Inactive
Detailed description of the entitlement.
Set to 'Yes' (default) to allow logging into the portal using the entitlement ID. Otherwise, set to 'No'.
Email address to which FlexNet Operations will send the license.
Specify the email template variation to use with this entitlement. Options are:
Account's postal address.
A unique string representing the end customer's (or channel partner's) Account to which the entitlement is assigned.
The distribution tier for this entitlement. The DistributionTierType is mandatory if the Account is specified. Distribution tiers available are:

End customer (or channel partner) contact's username (for example, email address). Use this when not specifying UserFirstName, UserLastName, UserEmail, and UserPhone. Account contact information is specified by either UserName, or combination of UserFirstName, UserLastName, UserEmail, and UserPhone.

End customer (or channel partner) contact's first name. Use this when not specifying UserName. Account contact information is specified by either UserName, or combination of UserFirstName, UserLastName, UserEmail, and UserPhone.

End customer (or channel partner) contact's last name. Use this when not specifying UserName. Account contact information is specified by either UserName, or combination of UserFirstName, UserLastName, UserEmail, and UserPhone.

End customer (or channel partner) contact's email address. Use this when not specifying UserName. Account contact information is specified by either UserName, or combination of UserFirstName, UserLastName, UserEmail, and UserPhone.

End customer (or channel partner) contact's phone number. Use this when not specifying UserName. Account contact information is specified by either UserName, or combination of UserFirstName, UserLastName, UserEmail, and UserPhone.
Set Account to be the current owner. Possible values:
Activation identifier for the line item. ActivationID will be auto-generated if this column is left blank and the StartDateType, ProductName, and ProductVersion columns are set for this line item.
Activation state for the line item. Options are: - Draft - Deployed (default) - Obsolete - Inactive
The order ID can either be imported from the accounting application, or you may enter it here.
The order line number can either be imported from the accounting application, or you may enter it here.

The type of order that is used to created this line item. Options are: - New (default) - Renewal - Upgrade - Upsell Note: If a line item has multiple products, then Upgrade, Upsell and Renewal line items can only be created by using the bulk operations wizard.
Parent line item's ActivationID. This only applies when OrderType is Renewal, Upgrade, or Upsell.
Detailed description for this line item.
Total quantity of this line item for the entitlement, this value must be greater than 0 in order for the line item to be deployed. The default is 1.

Start date options: - DefineNow (default) - StartDate column must be filled in - DefineAtFirstActivation - no additional version date columns must be filled in - DefineAtEachActivation - no additional version date columns must be filled in - DefineDateAtFirstActivation - no additional version date columns must be filled in - DefineDateAtEachActivation - no additional version date columns must be filled in
This field must be set if StartDateType=DefineNow. Format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY.

When a product's or product feature's Version Format Type is set to 'Date Based', the VersionDateType field must be set in the line item. VersionDateType options are: - DefineNow - VersionDate column must be filled in - UseActivationDate - VersionDurationUnits and VersionDuration columns must be filled in - UseStartDate - VersionDurationUnits and VersionDuration columns must be filled in - DefineLater - no additional version date columns must be filled in - DefineStartLater - VersionDurationUnits and VersionDuration columns must be filled in
This field must be set if VersionDateType=DefineNow. Format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY.
If the line item never expires set to 'Yes', otherwise set to 'No' (default). If set to 'No', either the EndDate or the EndDateDuration columns must be filled in.
This column must be set if IsActivationPermanent is set to 'No' and EndDateDuration is not set. Format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY.
End duration units must be set when IsActivationPermanent is set to 'No' and no EndDate is specified. EndDurationUnit options are: - Days (default) - Weeks - Months - Years
Line item validity duration. A numerical value to be used with EndDurationUnits. This must be set when IsActivationPermanent is set to 'No' and EndDate is not specified. Default is 0.

Version date duration unit to be used with VersionDuration. This field must be set if VersionDateType is set to either UseActivationDate, UseStartDate, or DefineStartLater. VersionDurationUnit options are: - Days (default) - Weeks - Months - Years

Version date duration numerical value (default is 0) to be used with VersionDurationUnits. This field must be set if VersionDateType is set to either UseActivationDate, UseStartDate , or DefineStartLater.
User's first name.
User's last name.
User's Email Address. Required to be unique across the entire site for FlexNet Operations Cloud. Highly recommended to be unique for FlexNet Operations On-Premises.
Identifier used for web services and sometimes displayed in the UI. If not provided, email address is used. For FlexNet Operations Cloud-this field is ignored.
User Roles defined for each user type. For multiple roles, each must be separated by a '|' field, e.g. Portal User Role|Portal Admin User Role|System Administrator
Set to 'YES' (default) for Active, 'NO' for InActive.
Expiry Date of user for respective account.Format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY.
Set to 'YES' if this account is shared by multiple users, otherwise set to 'NO' (default).
Set to 'YES' (default) if user can log into FlexNet Operations, otherwise set to 'NO', which creates a Contact.
User's Street Address.
User's City.
User's State.
User's Postal Code.

Should be the user's Time Zone roughly based on ISO-8601 format. Some examples are GMT-1.0DST60, GMT-1.0DST0, GMT3.5DST60) where the +/- offset in hours follows 'GMT' and DST0, DST60, DST120, denotes Daylight Savings hour offset values for a given region. For a complete list see the 'Importing and Exporting Entities' section of the Help pages: 'flexnet/help/Operations/wwhelp_Left.htm'.

This is the Locale in which all the portal text will be displayed. ISO 2 digit language code + “_” + ISO Country code are accepted. The complete list can be found at http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/javase7locales-334809.html. If the input is not supported the default is returned (en_US).
User's Phone Number.
User's Fax Number.
Set to 'YES' for user to receive marketing emails, otherwise set to 'NO' (default).
Set to 'YES' to receive notifications about expiring entitlements, otherwise set to 'NO' (default).
This field is informational only, provided when users are exported but not used when importing a user.
Account name as it is displayed in the UI when listing Accounts. More typically called 'Account Name' in most CRMs.
Account Type: PUBLISHER, CUSTOMER or CHANNEL_PARTNER.

Account's parent Account name. This field supports multiple values. Multiple values in a single cell may be specified by using the | (pipe) delimiter character. For example, the contents of the cell could be 'value1|value2|value3' to represent three values.
This is the Account's primary address.
This is the Account's secondary address.
Account's City
Account's State
Account's Postal Code
'To prevent channel partners from seeing this Account, set to 'No'. Otherwise set to 'Yes'.
Account's region. This is used for reporting only.
Description of the Account for internal notes only.
A Feature is a capability that you want to license in a Product. Feature Name must be specified if DeployState is "Deployed".
The version number of this Feature. Feature Version must be specified if DeployState is "Deployed".
Specify the feature type. Options are: Feature (default) Bundle
Enter a number that expresses the cardinality of the feature or feature bundle in the product. Default is 1.

Select the host type of this product. This field is mandatory for License Technologies that are not set to FlexNet Licensing, and have host types defined. Available host types for each license technology are:
License generator configuration with which this product works. License generator must be specified if DeployState is "Deployed". Available generators are:

The License Models linked to this product, a model must be specified prior to deployment. Multiple models are delimited with the | (pipe) character. For example model1|model2|model3. License Model must be specified if DeployState is "Deployed". Available model types are:
The Usage Model attribute is available when UsedOnDevice=Yes. Default is None. Enter the integral identifier associated with the usage model. The available usage models are:
Specify the start date of this product. Date format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY.
Specify the end date of this product. Date format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY.
Specify the email template variation to use with this product. Options are:
Name of the Maintenance Product you are selling.
The version number (E.g. 2 or 2.3) of this Maintenance Product.

Name of the old maintenance you are selling. This is mandatory if this is an update operation of maintenance name. Please note if this field has valid value it will be considered as an update of the maintenance name found matching the OldMaintenaceName and MaintenanceVersion, if maintenance is not found with the given OldMaintenaceName and MaintenanceVersion then there will be no update to the maintenance name. This field will be ignored in case a maintenance is found with the original maintenance name/version.
Set to 'Yes' if the maintenance covers associated product upgrades, 'No' (default) otherwise.
Set to 'Yes' if the maintenance covers associated product upsells, 'No' (default) otherwise.
Set to 'Yes' if the maintenance covers associated product renewals, 'No' (default) otherwise.
Product Line to map to this maintenance product. Available product lines are:
Existing product name to be mapped to this part number (must be exact match). The field is optional but required if submitting Product Version.
The product version associated with ProductName to which you want to map this part number. The field is optional but required if submitting Product Name.
The License model of the ProductName and ProductVersion to which you want to Map this Part Number. Available license models are:
To make the associated product available for trial registration set to 'Yes', otherwise set to 'No' (default).
Name (and identifier) of the product on entitlements.
The version of the product associated with entitlements. Examples: 2, 2.3, 2016 R1, Not Applicable

Specify the type of relationship between this ProductName and the RelatedProductName. Options are: - PRODUCTION_VERSION_OF - DEMO_OF - UPGRADE_FROM - UPGRADE_TO - UPSELL_FROM - UPSELL_TO - IS_MAINTENANCE - HAS_MAINTENANCE
The related product name (must be an exact match along with version).
The version number of the related product (must be an exact match).
Product type of the RelatedProductName. Values can be: - Product (default) - Suite - Maintenance
Name of the feature as used by the licensing technology in the application (binary) to turn on/off a licensed capacity or capability.

If a Fixed version format is selected, enter the latest (highest-numbered) version of this feature that is supported by a generated license certificate. For FlexNet Licensing technology, the version consists of numbers and at most one decimal point, with a ten character maximum, for example, 1 or 1.5. For custom license technologies:
Specify feature version format of 'Fixed' (default) or 'Date Based'.
Deployment State options: - Deployed (default) - Draft

Word used after displaying a quantity ("unit of measure") when displaying usage in Usage Reports UI and other reports. For example, bytes , kilobytes or gigabytes. Works with Scale to describe what metered feature is counting.

Used with Usage events only. Divider used to take actual quantity used and convert to a smaller number for display purposes in the Usage Reports UI and other reports. For example, if Units are in bytes but you want to report usage in kilobytes, enter 1024 for Scale.
Description of the feature and how it is used. Internal only.

Used in some licensing technology to add to specific vendor information on the license key. A feature level vendor overrides a license model, entitlement or activation. Variable substitution is available.

Used in some licensing technology to add to specific notice information on the license key. A feature level notice overrides a license model, entitlement or activation. Variable substitution is available.

Used in some licensing technology to add to specific number (numeric and text) on the license key. A feature level serial number overrides license model, entitlement or activation. Variable substitution is available.
Determines whether a feature is counted. Options are: - NO_OVERRIDE (Default) - Yes - No Choosing a value other than NO_OVERRIDE, overrides the value set in the license model.

Determines whether a feature is reusuable (only applies to metered features). Options are: - NO_OVERRIDE (Default) - Yes - No Choosing a value other than NO_OVERRIDE, overrides the value set in the license model.

Specify which combination of unique identifiers define a group. Options are: - NO_OVERRIDE (Default) - GROUPMASK - NONE Note: The ClientUniqueness setting is overridden if the GroupMask column exists. ClientUniqueness will be set to GROUPMASK if GroupMask contains a mask or NONE if a GroupMask column exists but is empty. Delete the GroupMask column if you do not want your ClientUniqueness setting overridden.

Available only with FlexNet Publisher licensing technology.
If feature's ClientUniquess is set to "GROUPMASK", then must specify groupings. Options are: USER, HOST, DISPLAY, VENDOR Use a comma to separate multiple (e.g., USER,DISPLAY)
Enter a unique description for a grouping of products (called product line).

Name of the old product line name. This is mandatory if this is an update operation of product line name. Please note if this field has valid value it will be considered as an update of the product line name found matching the OldProductLineName, if product line is not found with the given oldProductLineName then there will be no update to the product line name. This field will be ignored in case a product line is found with the original product line name.
Optional description of product line (internal only-not used in UI).
This is your company's unique identifier for this Download Package . We recommend that you use this field to facilitate Download Package management between versions, bug fixes, or patches.

This is the full name relating to the Download Package ID. The description may include producer name, version, operating system, encryption level, or language. This description appears on the " Download Package Information" page from the End-User Portal.
This is the Extended Description.
This is the version of the Download Package . This description appears on the " Download Package Information" page from the End-User Portal.

The Release Group of the Download Package controls the sorting of Download Package in FlexNet Operations on the " Download Package Information" page. The value of this field should include padding to force the desired sorting. If your Download Package follows a release number schema of x.y.z, the release group should be of the form xxx.yyy.zzz. For example version 9.1 would map to a Release Group of 009.001.000. Version 10.2.3 would map to 010.002.003. The Release Group could also just apply to the top level release number if desired. Version 10.1.2 could have a release group of 010 as would version 10 SP2. The second level sort of the Download Package list is the effective date of the Download Package .

The date the Download Package is available for download. The date description appears on the " Download Package Information" page from the End-User Portal site. Accounts have access to the Download Package if the Download Package 's Effective Date occurs within an Entitlement's Effective and Expiration dates on the Line Item for that Download Package. Date format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY.

If the Expiration Date is in the future the Download Package appears on the new versions section of the End-User Portal. If the Expiration Date is in the past, the Download Package moves to the “Previous Versions” tab in the End-User Portal. Accounts have access to the Download Package from the release archives section even if the Download Package is expired, provided there is an overlap between the Download Package 's Effective and Expiration dates and the Entitlement's Effective and Expiration dates. Date format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY.

Once this date has passed the Download Package will be moved to the “Previous Versions” tab in the End-User Portal. Users will still be able to download it if they have access through an overlap with their entitlement dates, but will not see it unless they click on the Archive tab on the FlexNet End-User Portal. (New entitlements with beginning dates after the Expiration date will not have access to this Download Package at all). Date format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY.

This is the Producer attribute for the Download Package. This is set up in the Products:Producers section of the Producer Portal. This is typically the same Producer attribute set on the Product this Download Package is associated to. The available Producers include:
Product Line to map to this Download Package. Available product lines are:

The End User License Agreement associated with this Download Package . The content for the EULA is set up in the Products section of FlexNet Producer Portal. The default value is blank. Available agreements are:

With this option set to 'true'/'yes', the End User will have the option to request a physical copy of the Download Package. When the End User requests physical delivery, an email is sent to the email address configured in FlexNet Operations. Otherwise set to 'false'/'no'.

If 'true'/'yes', export compliance validation will restrict export/distribution to the US and Canada only. If the value of 'true'/'yes' is used in this field, an ECCNCode value is not required. If 'false'/'no', then proceed to enter valid data combination for ECCNCode/ENCCode/CCATSCode fields

The ECCNCode for this Download Package. To enforce U.S. Dept. of Commerce export regulations you must provide information about the encryption levels and export licenses of the Download Packages. If you do not provide this information your Download Package cannot be delivered outside of the United States. For more information about the Dept. of Commerce regulations and the meaning of these codes please refer to the Bureau of Industry and Standards web site at http://www.bxa.doc.gov or contact your company's legal department. (NO_EXPORT/UNKNOWN/5D991/5D992/5D002/EAR99/3D002/3D991/3E991/3E201/4D993/4D994/4E992/4E993/5D001/5E991/5E992)
The ENCCode for this Download Package. See note on ECCNCode. (RETAIL/NON_RETAIL/TMP_BETA/TSU/UNKNOWN/RESTRICTED/UNRESTRICTED)

The CCATS code(s) for this Download Package. This field supports multiple values. Multiple values in a single cell may be specified by using the | (pipe) delimiter character. For example, the contents of the cell could be 'value1|value2|value3' to represent three values.
Enter text or HTML content in this field to make content appear above the list of downloads on the End-User Portal . (Example: "Please refer to the release notes for installation requirements.")
This is your company's unique identifier for this File. We recommend you use this field to facilitate file management between versions, bug fixes, or patches.
This is the full name of the File. The description may include producer name, version, operating system, encryption level, or language. This description appears on the End-User Portal.
This is the Extended Description.

The name of the File binary (for example: filename.zip). This field is overwritten with the name of the File when using the File Upload function. Alternately, this field may be edited to enter different content to present to the end user. File name is a mandatory field when a file is in LOADED state. Non-ascii characters are not allowed in the file name.
This is your company's unique identifier used to identify an existing File.

If using the Flexera FTP server, this is the relative path to the file on the ftp server. It should not begin with a forward slash (/) and is a Unix or URL style path (/ separates the directories). If using an external FTP server, enter a value in this format - ftp://user:password@host:port/path

The MD5 checksum for the file will always be a 32-digit hexadecimal value. If you calculate this before uploading to the ftp server and also pass it to FNO using this transaction, FNO can verify that the file was uploaded to the ftp server correctly.
This is your company's unique identifier for this Download Package . We recommend that you use this field to facilitate Download Package management between versions, bug fixes, or patches.
Name of the product to associate with this Download Package.
The Version of the Product to associate with this Download Package.
This is your company's unique identifier used to identify an existing File.
ID of the download package, to associate the file. This is your company's unique identifier used to identify an existing Download Package.
The sort order of the files associated with the download package.
The maintenance line item activation id that will be associated with this product.

columnref.note: Activation identifier for the maintenance line item. The ActivationID will be auto-generated if this column is left blank and the StartDate, ProductName, and ProductVersion columns are set for this line item.

column.note: Specify the activation id of the line item to which this maintenance line item is linked with.

columnref.note: Activation state for the maintenance line item. Options are: - Draft - Deployed (default) - Obsolete - Inactive
The version number (for example, 2 or 2.3) of the maintenance product.
The product part number mapped to this maintenance line.
Specify the start date of this maintenance line item. Date format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY.
If the maintenance line item never expires set to 'Yes', otherwise set to 'No' (default). If set to 'No', the EndDate column must be filled in.
This must column must be set if IsActivationPermanent is set to 'No'. Format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY.

Start date options: - DefineAtFirstActivation (default) - no additional version date columns must be filled in - DefineAtEachActivation - no additional version date columns must be filled in - DefineDateAtFirstActivation - no additional version date columns must be filled in - DefineDateAtEachActivation - no additional version date columns must be filled in
Name of the bulk entitlement product.
The version number (for example, 2 or 2.3) of the bulk entitlement product.
The product part number mapped to this bulk entitlement product.
The identifier that uniquely identifies the Bulk Entitlement that the Web Register Keys will be associated with.

column.note: Specify the Web Register Key identifier. If this field is left empty, then the system will auto-generate a number of Web Register Keys as specified by the NumberOfCopies field.
Specify the number of Web Register Keys to auto-generate when the WebRegisterKey field is empty (this field is ignored if the WebRegisterKey is not empty). The default value is 1.
The unique alphanumeric identification of the Update.
The name of the update.
Determines whether the Update will be visible to the requesting client. - active (default) - inactive
The date when the update will be available. Date format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY. Default (today's date)
The date the update expires. Date format is YYYY-MM-DD, or MM/DD/YYYY.
A description of the update
Indicates how an entitlement check should be performed before returning the update. Valid values are : Account (default),Device or None
The ID of a download package that the update is for. At least one release from download package ID must be specified for a create.
The ID of the download package that will be delivered for the update. At least one release to download package ID must be specified for a create.

Platforms associated with the update to download package. For multiple platforms, each must be separated by a '|' field. At least one platform must be specified for a download package. Valid platforms are:
The language for the update. At least one language must be specified for a create. Valid languages are:
Update title that is sent to the client. This field is required if languageName has been specified.
Update description that is sent to the client. This field is required if languageName has been specified.
